subject: p19623993
History: Autoimmune hepatitis with altered mental status.
Findings: In comparison with the study of, there is continued pulmonary vascular congestion. Increased opacification at the bases, especially on the right, could merely reflect atelectasis in a patient with low lung volumes. However, the possibility of superimposed aspiration would have to be considered in the appropriate clinical setting. Monitoring and support devices remain in place.
